snippet: At a time of deepening austerity, Britons seem to have turned against their national leaders in bellwether mayoral and local council elections.
abstract: London Mayor Boris Johnson provides a modest lift for the British Conservative Party after winning re-election amid a deluge of defeats for his party in local races; victory establishes Johnson as a potentially serious nuisance, if not credible threat, to Prime Min David Cameron, who has come under attack recently from both the left and the right.

byline.contributor: John F. Burns contributed reporting from London, and Alan Cowell from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: At a time of deepening austerity, Britons seem to have turned against their national leaders in bellwether mayoral and local council elections.

headline.seo: Conservatives Fare Poorly in British Races, London’s Mayor Aside
headline.main: London’s Mayor Aside, Conservatives Fare Poorly in British Races
headline.print_headline: London’s Mayor Aside, Conservatives Fare Poorly in British Races
